basic timing of hands and feet
relax and tense at the proper moment
angle changes in preparation for mass attack
how to use opposite arm as a hidden weapon

repetition of the four basic blocks while retreating

steps.step: Move your left foot back to 6:00 as you step into a right neutral bow. Simultaneously execute a right hammering inward block with a left back elbow strike. Your left hand should be at your left hip after the back elbow strike.
Move your right foot back to 6:00 as you step into a left neutral bow. Simultaneously execute a left hammering inward block with a right back elbow strike.
Execute a left side cover moving your right foot to 3:00 ending in a left neutral bow facing 9:00. Simultaneously execute a left outward vertical block with a right back elbow strike.
Move your left foot back to 3:00 as you step into a right neutral bow facing 9:00. Simultaneously execute a right outward vertical block with a left back elbow strike.
Execute a rear cover, turning to face 3:00 in a left neutral bow. Simultaneously execute a left upward block with a right back elbow strike.
Move your left foot back to 9:00 as you step into a right neutral bow. Simultaneously execute a right upward block with a left back elbow strike.
Execute a right side cover moving your left foot to 12:00 ending in a right neutral bow facing 6:00. Simultaneously execute a right downward block with a left back elbow strike.
Move your right foot back to 12:00 as you step into a left neutral bow. Simultaneously execute a left downward block while executing a right back elbow strike.

Return to a meditating horse stance by moving your left leg clockwise to 9:00. You should now be in your starting position facing 12:00. Return to your attention stance and finish with the Kenpo greeting followed by a short bow.
